TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class SqlXml : System.Data.SqlTypes.INullable, System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable
.class public auto ansi serializable sealed beforefieldinit SqlXml extends System.Object implements class System.Data.SqlTypes.INullable, class System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable

Docs.summary: Represents XML data stored in or retrieved from a server.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This class contains an instance of an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>-derived type, and adds SQL-specific features such as database-style null semantics by implementing the <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.INullable> interface. When you use SqlXml, the XML value that you assign to the SqlXml instance must be consumable by an <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>. For unicode data, the Byte Order Mark (`BOM`) must be present in the stream of data.

.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.IO.Stream value) cil managed

Docs.param: A <xref:System.IO.Stream>-derived instance (such as ) from which to load the instance's Xml content.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance, supplying the XML value from the supplied <xref:System.IO.Stream>-derived instance.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Xml.XmlReader value) cil managed

Docs.param: An <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>-derived class instance to be used as the value of the new instance.
Docs.summary: Creates a new instance and associates it with the content of the supplied <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If this value is null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), the instance is set so that <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.INullable.IsNull%2A> returns `true`.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance class System.Xml.XmlReader CreateReader() cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the XML content of this as a <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>.
Docs.returns: A <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>-derived instance that contains the XML content. The actual type may vary (for example, the return value might be <xref:System.Xml.XmlTextReader>) depending on how the information is represented internally, on the server.

remarks.format: ## Remarks If the <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlXml> instance was initialized to null (`Nothing` in Visual Basic), this method returns null.

Docs.exception: Attempt was made to access this property on a null instance of .
Docs.value: A <xref:System.Xml.XmlReader>-derived instance that contains the XML content. The actual type may vary (for example, the return value might be <xref:System.Xml.XmlTextReader>) depending on how the information is represented internally, on the server.

Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema> that describes the XML representation of the object that is produced by the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable.WriteXml%2A> method and consumed by the <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable.ReadXml%2A> method.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Data.SqlTypes.SqlXml> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable> interface.
